Package BrickDestroy.Gameplay_Model.LevelFactory

Class LevelFactory

java.lang.Object
BrickDestroy.Gameplay_Model.LevelFactory.LevelFactory
public class LevelFactory extends Object
LevelFactory is used to create (or build) different types of level for the game. It also stores the info required for building each level.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelFactory

      public LevelFactory(javafx.scene.layout.Pane drawArea, int brickCount, int lineCount, double brickDimensionRatio)
      Initialises the LevelFactory with the corresponding draw area, number of bricks, lines and the ratio of the brick.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - the pane where the game is drawn
      brickCount - the amount of bricks in the level
      lineCount - the number of lines of bricks in the game
      brickDimensionRatio - the ratio between the width and height of the brick

  • Method Details

    • getThisLevel

      public Level getThisLevel(int level)
      Generates the level of the current number with its brick type.
      Parameters:
      level - number of level to be generated
      Returns:
      the generated level from the level number with the corresponding brick types

    • makeLevel

      private Level makeLevel(int typeA, int typeB)
      Makes the level with the corresponding brick types
      Parameters:
      typeA - first type of brick (appears the least in the level)
      typeB - second type of brick (appears the most in the level)
      Returns:
      the level generated

    • makeLevel

      private Brick[] makeLevel(javafx.scene.layout.Pane drawArea, int brickCnt, int numberOfLines, double brickSizeRatio, int typeA, int typeB)
      Makes the level based on the size of the draw area, number of bricks and line, ratio of brick size and the types of brick
      Parameters:
      drawArea - the area where the bricks are drawn
      brickCnt - number of bricks (it will be increased by some to fill the edges)
      numberOfLines - number of lines of bricks
      brickSizeRatio - width to height ratio of the size of the brick
      typeA - first type of brick (appears the least in the level)
      typeB - second type of brick (appears the most in the level)
      Returns:
      the array of bricks for the levels

    • decideBricksPattern

      private boolean decideBricksPattern(int index, int currentLine, int brickIndexOnRow, int bricksPerLine)
      Decides what type of brick to generate based on the pattern of the level intended.

      Odd numbered rows contains bricks arranged in a chessboard manner. Even numbered rows contains bricks arranged with the middle containing second type and the edges contains the first type.

      Parameters:
      index - index of the current brick in question
      currentLine - current line number
      brickIndexOnRow - index of the current brick on the current row
      bricksPerLine - number of bricks on one line (excluding the edge filler bricks)
      Returns:
      indicator for first type or second type of brick

    • makeBrick

      private Brick makeBrick(javafx.geometry.Point2D point, javafx.geometry.Dimension2D size, int type)
      Makes the corresponding brick type with the intended location and size.
      Parameters:
      point - upper-left of the brick
      size - size of brick
      type - type of brick
      Returns:
      brick object of the intended type

    • setBrickDimension

      private javafx.geometry.Dimension2D setBrickDimension(javafx.scene.layout.Pane drawArea, int brickOnLine, double brickSizeRatio)
      Calculates the dimension of the brick.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - area of where the bricks are drawn
      brickOnLine - number of bricks per line
      brickSizeRatio - width to height ratio of brick
      Returns:
      dimension object of the brick

    • roundBrickCnt

      private int roundBrickCnt(int brickCnt, int lineCnt)
      Rounds the amount of Bricks so that it fits exactly in the screen according to the number of lines
      Parameters:
      brickCnt - number of bricks on the leve;
      lineCnt - number of lines
      Returns:
      rounded number of bricks that fits the draw area with the intended number of lines
